intro: Glochidion cavaleriei, commonly known as the Cavalerie's Glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Vietnam and Cambodia. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
